required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Colchicine and Nonsteroidal Anti-inflammatory Drug Combination Therapy and Renal Function in Gout Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Colchicine and Nonsteroidal Anti-inflammatory Drug Combination Therapy and Renal Function in Gout Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Our findings are expected to provide real-world evidence of the renal-adverse effects of colchicine and NSAIDs combination therapy in patients with gout, which will guide healthcare professions in optimizing gout treatment regimens and evaluating risks of renal impairment.

detailed_description.textblock:
Background: Gout is a common prevalent disease, which causes a low quality of life and poses a significant health burden nationally and internationally. Colchicine and Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) are the mainstay treatment of gout. Concurrent use of colchicine and NSAIDs are more than half in all prescriptions of the gout patients. Both colchicine and NSAIDs may cause renal impairment. However, the empirical evidence of renal impairment of colchicine and NSAIDs combination therapy is limited and even absent.
Objectives: This proposal will assess the association between colchicine and NSAIDs combination therapy and acute kidney injury. The investigators further evaluate the relationships of duration-response, recency-response, and dose-response.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with a diagnosis of acute kidney injury

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with a death record

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with a dialysis record

arm_group.description: Cases were defined as patients with an event of renal impairment during follow-up, such as acute kidney injury.
Cases were defined as patients without an event of renal impairment during follow-up, such as acute kidney injury.
Exposure was defined as patients with colchicine and NSAIDs combination therapy.
Non-Exposure was defined as patients with other gout therapy.

intervention.description: Colchicine and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug combination therapy

study_pop.textblock: Patients diagnosed with gout and initiating anti-gout drug

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of a gout diagnosis
- Initially receiving at least one anti-gout drug
Exclusion Criteria:
- <1 year of continuous health insurance enrollment
- Colchicine and NSAID use before the cohort entry date
- Patients with hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis before the cohort entry date
- Patients with acute kidney injury before the cohort entry date
